intro: Impatiens fugongensis, commonly known as the Fugong Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that come in a range of colors including pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
